DataElement.preferredName: Agent Administered Alternative Agent Administered Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the agent or drug administered to a patient as an alternative therapy to the protocol assigned therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the administration of an agent or drug to a patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Use caBIG NCIt based OC instead. - dw

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the agent administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

PermissibleValues.value: Radiation therapy (not as a part of stem cell transplant conditioning)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

PermissibleValues.value: Chemotherapy (not as a part of stem cell transplant conditioning)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

PermissibleValues.value: Stem Cell Transplant, including pre-transplant conditioning/radiation therapy (hematopoietic stem cell transplant, bone marrow transplant)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bone Marrow Transplantation Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bone Marrow Transplantation Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure to replace diseased or pathologic bone marrow with transplanted healthy bone marrow cells.: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

Concepts.definition: A procedure to replace diseased bone marrow with transplanted healthy bone marrow cells.

A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An arabinonucleoside antimetabolite with antineoplastic activity. Nelarabine is demethoxylated by adenosine deaminase to become biologically active 9-beta-D-arabinosylguanine (ara-G); ara-G incorporates into DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA synthesis and inducing an S phase-dependent apoptosis of tumor cells. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: An arabinonucleoside antimetabolite with antineoplastic activity. Nelarabine is demethoxylated by adenosine deaminase to become biologically active 9-beta-D-arabinosylguanine (ara-G); ara-G incorporates into DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA synthesis and inducing an S phase-dependent apoptosis of tumor cells. (NCI04)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Added to contain specific PVs for AALL1231 Supplemental Reporting CRF.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created to capture alternative therapies received by patients on the AALL1231 Supplemental Reporting CRF.
